page.title: 05 Simpson Barracks, Wootton.
page.content: The barracks and surrounding land covers quite a large area on the northern edge of Wootton village. It is the main training establishment for recruits to the Royal Pioneer Corps.The recruits can join the Army when they leave school and may leave again when they are 22. The officers can start at the same age but may stay on until they are 45. The barracks was built in 1942 on farmland. It provides quarters for families to live in and a mess for the officers. The soldiers practice with hand weapons on the small firing range and there are seven vehicles of various kinds for them to work with. There is a museum of weapons and uniforms in the barracks.
